reg:regulation.reg:acttitle: Balanced Budget and Ministerial Accountability Act
reg:regulation.reg:title: Minister of State for Workforce Development Expected Results for the 2022/2023 Fiscal Year Regulation

bcl:section.bcl:text: This regulation applies to the Minister of State for Workforce Development for the 2022/2023 fiscal year.
In this regulation, Act means the Balanced Budget and Ministerial Accountability Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Minister of State for Workforce Development
bcl:section.bcl:text: The expected results that the Minister of State for Workforce Development is to achieve for the purposes of section 5 (3) of the Act are as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: prepare workplans to fulfil each commitment identified in the mandate letter of December 7, 2022 to the Minister of State for Workforce Development;

engage with non-profit organizations, new international arrivals, and community leaders to identify issues and barriers preventing internationally trained workers from working in their fields to the full extent of their abilities;
evaluate approaches taken in other jurisdictions and propose additional measures to advance a successful foreign credential recognition program;

support the Minister of Post-Secondary Education and Future Skills to ensure government can respond quickly if private institutions promote or offer sub-standard education to international students, and to advance the development of protections for international students that support their fair treatment across the sector;
submit to Cabinet a report on the results referred to in paragraphs (a) through (d) on or before March 31, 2023.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Balanced Budget and Ministerial Accountability Act, S.B.C. 2001, c. 28, s. 9.]
